newsitem.title: CZECH REPUBLIC: Czech PX50 closes higher led by major issues.
newsitem.headline: Czech PX50 closes higher led by major issues.

text.p: The Czech PX50 index closed higher for the fifth straight session on Wednesday led by blue chip issues.
Three of the four most heavily capitalised shares on the Prague bourse rose with Ceska Sporitelna, the only loser, dropping four crowns to 312.
SPT Telecom led the gainers with a 39 crown rise to 3,125, CEZ rose 10 crowns to 971 and Komercni Banka gained five crowns to 2,085.
Despite the strength of major issues, there were some big decliners in the broader market.
Among the most spectacular fallers was glass fibre maker Vertex which lost 193 crowns to 3,667.

Analysts say Vertex has been plotting a steadily downward course since a takeover battle for the company in June between IPB group and Komercni Banka group which took the price to a 12-month high of 7,204.

"The price was so inflated after the takeover battle. The price shouldn't be over 2,000. It shouldn't be any diferent from where it started ( before the takeover)," said Lindsay Ashford of Zivnostenska Banka.
Other big decliners included Ceska Radiokomunikace which fell 192 crowns to 3,658 and Ceska Pojistovna which lost 105 crowns to 3,000.
Activity remained thin with turnover of 587 million crowns.
